original: Låftman, Åke Kurt Erik, kommendörkapten, Sjötorp, f. 5/7/82 i Gnesta, Södermani. 1., av baning. Rich. L. o. Valborg Maria Jäderlund. G. 12 m. Karin Lindström. Barn: Jukka f. 36. — Sjöoff:ex. 05, KSHS 10-11. Und:-löjtn. v. flottan 05, löjtn. 07, kapt. 15, komm:kapt. av andra gr. 27, av första gr. 33. Avsk. m. fört :pens. 36, sluss-imsp. v. Göta Kanalbol. i Sjötorp fr. s. å., samtid, uppbördsman h. Vänerns segl :’Styr. Inneh. ett flert. chefis-skap på torped- o. segelfartyg, skepps-goisseavd., sign :>sk ::avd., pansarsk. Manligheten o. Gustav V. Långresa m. Gustaf V t. Medelhavet 33-34. Tre år i följd erövr. H. M. Konungens hed:pris f. stridsskjutn. å flottans fartyg. RSO, KBLeopII:sO, KNS :tOO, KPolRest2kl, RDDO.
translated: Låftman, Åke Kurt Erik, Commander Captain, Sjötorp, b. 5/7/82 in Gnesta, Södermani. Son of Rich. L. and Valborg Maria Jäderlund. Married on 12th [month] with Karin Lindström. Children: Jukka b. 36. — Naval officer: graduated in 1905, KSHS 10-11 [unknown abbreviation]. Sub-lieutenant in the navy in 1905, lieutenant in 1907, captain in 1915, commander captain of the second group in 1927, of the first group in 1933. Retired with retirement pension in 1936, lock inspector for the Göta Kanal Company in Sjötorp from the same year, also served as revenue officer for Vänern's sailing :’Steering. Held several positions as chief on torpedo and sailing ships, the shipboys division, signal division, armored division. Participated in long voyages with Gustav V to the Mediterranean in 1933-34. Three consecutive years awarded His Majesty the King's honorary prize for combat shooting on navy ships. RSO [unknown abbreviation], Order of the Sword KBL II [unknown abbreviation], KNS [unknown abbreviation], Police Reserve Medal 2nd class, RDDO [unknown abbreviation].

awards.name: Order of the Sword KBL II [unknown abbreviation]
